Document.TEXT: Sensata Technologies Holding (NYSE:ST) was downgraded by Atlantic Securities from an overweight rating to a neutral rating in a research note issued to investors on Thursday, The Fly reports. Shares of Sensata Technologies Holding ( NYSE:ST ) traded down 4.65% on Thursday, reaching $31.81. 1,237,122 shares of the company's stock were exchanged. Sensata Technologies Holding has a one year low of $31.60 and a one year high of $55.53. The firm has a 50 day moving average of $39.64 and a 200 day moving average of $44.97. The firm has a market capitalization of $5.42 billion and a P/E ratio of 15.67. Sensata Technologies Holding (NYSE:ST) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, February 2nd. The company reported $0.66 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $0.65 by $0.01. The company had revenue of $726.50 million for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $722.45 million. The firm's quarterly revenue was up 3.0% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same quarter in the prior year, the firm posted $0.57 EPS. On average, equities research analysts predict that Sensata Technologies Holding will post $2.85 EPS for the current year. ST has been the topic of a number of other reports. Zacks Investment Research raised shares of Sensata Technologies Holding from a sell rating to a hold rating in a report on Monday, October 12th. Citigroup Inc. cut shares of Sensata Technologies Holding from a buy rating to a neutral rating in a report on Wednesday, October 7th. Stifel Nicolaus cut their target price on shares of Sensata Technologies Holding from $54.00 to $50.00 and set a buy rating on the stock in a report on Monday, January 11th. RBC Capital cut their target price on shares of Sensata Technologies Holding from $50.00 to $45.00 and set a sector perform rating on the stock in a report on Friday, January 15th. Finally, Wells Fargo cut shares of Sensata Technologies Holding from an outperform rating to a market perform rating and set a $37.03 target price on the stock. in a report on Thursday, January 21st. Nine equities research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and seven have given a buy rating to the company's stock. Sensata Technologies Holding presently has a consensus rating of Hold and an average target price of $48.00. Several large investors recently modified their holdings of ST. State of Wisconsin Investment Board bought a new stake in shares of Sensata Technologies Holding during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $14,771,000. Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft FI raised its stake in shares of Sensata Technologies Holding by 25.2% in the fourth quarter. Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft FI now owns 11,071 shares of the company's stock valued at $510,000 after buying an additional 2,231 shares during the last quarter. Oxford Asset Management bought a new stake in shares of Sensata Technologies Holding during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $1,928,000. Denver Investment Advisors LLC raised its stake in shares of Sensata Technologies Holding by 19.8% in the fourth quarter. Denver Investment Advisors LLC now owns 29,474 shares of the company's stock valued at $1,358,000 after buying an additional 4,880 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Swiss National Bank raised its stake in shares of Sensata Technologies Holding by 1.5% in the fourth quarter. Swiss National Bank now owns 307,650 shares of the company's stock valued at $14,170,000 after buying an additional 4,600 shares during the last quarter. In other Sensata Technologies Holding news, SVP Martin J. Carter sold 66,000 shares of the business's stock in a transaction on Tuesday, November 17th. The shares were sold at an average price of $43.87, for a total transaction of $2,895,420.00. Following the sale, the senior vice president now directly owns 38,080 shares in the company, valued at approximately $1,670,569.60. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available through the SEC website . Sensata Technologies Holding N.V. is a global industrial technology company. The Company is engaged in the development, manufacture and sale of sensors and controls. The Company's operating segments include Sensors segment and Controls segment. The Company produce sensors and controls for applications such as thermal circuit breakers in aircraft, pressure sensors in automotive systems, and bimetal current and temperature control devices in electric motors.
